p: The wound healing experimental procedure was performed according to a previous study [ 10, 40]. A carboxymethyl cellulose (CMC)/hyaluronic acid (HA)/sodium alginate (SA) hydrogel [ 41, 42] was prepared on one side of a non-woven fabric for releasing the extracted S. mukorossi seed oil. The ratio of the CMC, HA, and SA in the hydrogels was 1:3:12. Before the study, the rats’ backs were one-way clipped (5 × 5 cm) with an electric animal shaver and the disinfected with 75% alcohol. Then, the rats were anesthetized with 5% isoflurane in an induction chamber. Before the experiment, one linear wound with an area of 2 × 2 cm was made by excising the skin on the back of the rat using sterile scissors.
